name: Three-Act Structure
description: Classic three-act storytelling structure with setup, confrontation, and resolution
distribution_philosophy: Based on traditional three-act structure with Act 2 receiving the most development

setup.name: Setup (Act 1)
setup.description: Introduce the protagonist, establish the ordinary world, and present the inciting incident

confrontation_first_half.name: Confrontation - First Half (Act 2A)
confrontation_first_half.description: The protagonist enters the new world and faces initial obstacles

midpoint.name: Midpoint
midpoint.description: A major turning point that shifts the story's direction

confrontation_second_half.name: Confrontation - Second Half (Act 2B)
confrontation_second_half.description: Complications intensify leading to the crisis

crisis.name: Crisis
crisis.description: The protagonist faces their greatest challenge

climax.name: Climax (Act 3)
climax.description: The final confrontation and resolution of the main conflict

resolution.name: Resolution
resolution.description: The aftermath and new equilibrium after the climax
